titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Cavalry Club of Brooklyn, Squadron C photograph collection V1982.004
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Weatherly Stephan
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-28T14:15-0500

did.unittitle: Cavalry Club of Brooklyn, Squadron C photograph collection

physdesc.extent: in one folder, one oversize box, and one oversize drawer.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition for this collection are unknown.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection contains 21 photographs dating from circa 1900 to 1955. Photographs relate to the Cavalry Club of Brooklyn, Squadron C (formally known as the 101st Cavalry Regiment) including group portraits, company photographs, and annual dinners. Images of the Squadron's camp and horses, as well as other regional squadrons, are also included.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids note
otherfindaid.p: Item-level description and digital versions of images from the collection are available for searching via the image database in the library.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: Copyright will remain in effect for 120 years following the date of creation. All items in this collection will enter the public domain by 2075. For information on securing rights to publish or reproduce, please see the Brooklyn Historical Society Reproduction Rights Policy.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Cavalry Club of Brooklyn, Squadron C photograph collection, V1982.004, Box number, Object ID number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: Documents and records from the Cavalry Club of Brooklyn, Squadron C are also available at the Brooklyn Historical Society. Consult with library staff for more details.
